@description.name: @description
@description.body:
Dynamically load non qx scripts. This class is aware of all scripts that have been loaded using its instances, so if two instances load jquery, it will only be loaded once, and the second instance will wait for the jquery to be loaded before continuing to load additional scripts. Usage example: 

  ... assets ...
 /**
* @asset(myapp/jquery/*)
* @asset(myapp/highcharts/*)
*
* @ignore(jQuery.*)
* @ignore(Highcharts.*)
  ...

    var src = '';
    var min = '.min';
    if (qx.core.Environment.get("qx.debug")) {
      src = '.src';
      min = '';
    }

    var dynLoader = new qx.util.DynamicScriptLoader([
        "myapp/jquery/jquery"+min+".js",
        "myapp/highcharts/highcharts"+src+".js",
        "myapp/highcharts/highcharts-more"+src+".js",
        "myapp/highcharts/highcharts-modifications.js"
    ]);
    dynLoader.addListenerOnce('ready',function(e){
      console.log("all scripts have been loaded!");
    });
    dynLoader.addListener('failed',function(e){
      var data = e.getData();
      console.log("failed to load "+data.script);
    });
    dynLoader.start();

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Create a loader for the given scripts.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: scriptArr {Array|String} the uri name(s) of the script(s) to load
@param.description: the uri name(s) of the script(s) to load

@description.name: @description
@description.body: fired when a script is loaded successfully. The data contains 'script' and 'status' keys.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: fired when a specific script fails loading. The data contains 'script' and 'status' keys.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: fired when all given scripts are loaded, each time loadScriptsDynamic is called.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Map of scripts being added at the present time. Key is script name; value is instance of this class which is loading it.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Map of scripts that have fully loaded. Key is script name; value is true

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Array of the scripts to be loaded

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Start loading scripts. This may only be called once!

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Promise?} a promise which will be resolved after load of all scripts if promise support is enabled; nothing (undefined) if promises are not enabled.
@return.description: a promise which will be resolved after load of all scripts if promise support is enabled; nothing (undefined) if promises are not enabled.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Chain loading scripts. Recursively called until the array of scripts is consumed

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxOwner. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxOwner. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxOwner}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Gets the (computed) value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Sets the user value of the property qxObjectId. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Resets the user value of the property qxObjectId. The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depending on the property configuration and value availability. For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #qxObjectId}.
